epd_owner.name: Holcim (Australia) Pty Ltd
epd_owner.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

epd_produced_by.name: Edge Environment Pty Ltd
epd_produced_by.address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia

epd_process_certified_by.name: Epsten Group
epd_process_certified_by.address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA

epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
epd_metadata.notes_on_comparability: EPDs within the same product category but registered in different EPD programmes, or not compliant with EN 15804, may not be comparable. For comparability, EPDs must be based on the same PCR version, cover products with identical functions, have equivalent system boundaries, data quality, cut-off rules, and impact assessment methods.

product_description.general_description: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Fresh concrete is placed on site or prefabricated, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

concrete_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
concrete_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, with technical parameters such as high strength, durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high pumpability, architectural finishes.

product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation.
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging.

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified; scope is cradle to delivery

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
databases_and_software.note_on_impact_categories: Some impact categories (EN15804+A1 and Green Star v1.3) modelled separately based on generic processes.

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m続 of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical not possible.

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transport to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging except packaging of materials.

data_quality.assessment: Good or very good geographic and temporal representativeness; all background data updated within 10 years as required by PCR 2019:14.

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for A1 and A3.
system_boundaries.core_processes: External and internal transport; manufacturing of concrete excluding mixing (mixing in truck considered A4); treatment of waste and wastewater.
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, wastage on site, transport and treatment of waste at end of life.
system_boundaries.other_lifecycle_stages_excluded: Material emissions from usage, maintenance, repair, replacement, refurbishment, operational energy and water use.

installation.operational_control: Holcim has no operational control over installation
installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool; includes pouring from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms.

end_of_life.control: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.use_of_recycled_aggregate: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements.

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime, offsetting some emissions from cement manufacturing.
carbonation.note: Carbonation not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results.

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.database_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

additional_info.disclaimer: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks. Some impact categories have high uncertainty or limited experience.
